result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Mahl, Megan M.
defendant.address: W3312 County Rd N, Owen, WI 54460

records.addlTxt:
FINDING OF GOOD CAUSE TO EXTEND PRELIMINARY HEARING
TIME LIMITS
Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.

The defendant shall have no contact with Brittany Fellenz of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  The defendant shall have no contact with BAL of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way unless supervised and approved by the Child protective services department. Defendant is to remain alcohol and drug free/maintaining absolute sobriety. Defendant is not to possess any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or syringes. Additionally, defendant may possess prescription drugs only when prescribed by a medical professional for the defendant, which shall be taken as prescribed.
AMENDED 08/02/2022 from a $2500 cash bond.

1:49 PM Defendant Megan M. Mahl appeared by video from Clark County Jail   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.   Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Megan M. Mahl.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of the complaint  Requesting a signature bond - State objects.  Court will modify account to a $500.00 cash bond.  No waiver of PH, will need to be set within 20 days.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
